solution_line_template: Because it is cheaper to buy the packs of 5, the teacher should satisfy the {vampire_students} students who want the vampire theme with {vampire_packs} packs of {pack_size} and {vampire_individuals} individual bag. This will cost the teacher {vampire_packs}*{pack_price} + {vampire_individuals}*{individual_price} = $<<{vampire_packs}*{pack_price}+{vampire_individuals}*{individual_price}={vampire_cost}>>{vampire_cost}.

Similarly, the {pumpkin_students} students who want a pumpkin-themed bag can be satisfied by {pumpkin_packs} packs of {pack_size} and {pumpkin_individuals} individual bags at a cost of {pumpkin_packs}*{pack_price} + {pumpkin_individuals}*{individual_price} = $<<{pumpkin_packs}*{pack_price}+{pumpkin_individuals}*{individual_price}={pumpkin_cost}>>{pumpkin_cost}.
